page.title: 05St John's Church, Gt Clacton
page.content: The thick walls of{St John's {Parish Church}contain bricks from older buildings, some of which are {Roman. The{nave}dates back to 1050 AD. The{Norman chancel}was changed in the 14th century when two windows were inserted in the south wall. The{tower}was built in the 15th century. The buttresses are there to hold up a massive tower which was never completed. Instead a weatherboard belfry with a low spire was added. In the tower are five ancient bells. The sixth was added in 1974. The{baptism font}dates back from the 15th century but the eight faces have been broken or knocked off.
